001package imagingbook.lib.ij;
002
003import java.awt.Polygon;
004
005import ij.gui.OvalRoi;
006import ij.gui.Overlay;
007import ij.gui.PointRoi;
008import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
009import ij.gui.Roi;
010import ij.process.FloatPolygon;
011import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
012
013/**
014 * This class defines static ROI-related utility methods
015 * to interface with ImageJ.
016 * 
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public class RoiUtils {
021        
022        /**
023         * Retrieves the outline of the specified ROI as an
024         * array of {@link Pnt2d} points with {@code int}
025         * coordinates. Note that unless the ROI is of type
026         * {@link PolygonRoi} or {@link PointRoi} only the corner points of the
027         * bounding box are returned.
028         * Interpolated contour points are returned for a instance of {@link OvalRoi}.
029         * 
030         * @param roi the ROI
031         * @return the ROI's polygon coordinates
032         */
033        public static Pnt2d[] getPolygonPointsInts(Roi roi) {
034                Polygon pgn = roi.getPolygon();
035                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[pgn.npoints];
036                for (int i = 0; i < pgn.npoints; i++) {
037                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.PntInt.from(pgn.xpoints[i], pgn.ypoints[i]);
038                }
039                return pts;
040        }
041        
042        /**
043         * Retrieves the outline of the specified ROI as an
044         * array of {@link Pnt2d} points with {@code int}
045         * coordinates. Note that unless the ROI is of type
046         * {@link PolygonRoi} or {@link PointRoi} only the corner points of the
047         * bounding box are returned.
048         * Interpolated contour points are returned for a instance of {@link OvalRoi}.
049         * 
050         * @param roi the ROI
051         * @return the ROI's polygon coordinates
052         */
053        public static Pnt2d[] getPolygonPointsFloat(Roi roi) {
054                FloatPolygon pgn = roi.getFloatPolygon();
055                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[pgn.npoints];
056                for (int i = 0; i < pgn.npoints; i++) {
057                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.PntDouble.from(pgn.xpoints[i], pgn.ypoints[i]);
058                }
059                return pts;
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Returns a new overlay produced by joining two existing
064         * overlays, which remain unchanged. All involved ROIs are cloned.
065         * 
066         * @param olyA the first overlay
067         * @param olyB the second overlay
068         * @return the new overlay
069         */
070        public static Overlay join(Overlay olyA, Overlay olyB) {
071                Overlay oly = olyA.duplicate();
072                for (Roi roi : olyB) {
073                        oly.add((Roi)roi.clone());
074                }
075                return oly;
076        }
077        
078}
